lineage.Process: NOTE: This is not Python code! Data processing on Quadrat Shapefiles...

citRespParty.rpOrgName: Northern Arizona University School of Forestry
Northern Arizona University School of Forestry

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This dataset consists of 98 permanent 1-m2 quadrats located on ponderosa pineâ€“bunchgrass ecosystems in or near Flagstaff, Arizona, USA. Individual plants in these quadrats were identified and mapped annually from 2002-2020. The temporal and spatial data provide unique opportunities to examine the effects of climate and land-use variables on plant demography, population and community processes. The original chart quadrats were established between 1912 and 1927 to determine the effects of livestock grazing on herbaceous plants and pine seedlings. We provide the following data and data formats: (1) Digitized maps in shapefile and file geodatabase format (2) Shapefiles of each individual species observed on each quadrat in each year, organized into separate subfolders by Species, Site and Quadrat. These single-species shapefiles are formatted to input directly into Integral Projection Modeling (IPM) analysis in R. (3) Tabular representation of centroid or point location (x, y coordinates) for species mapped as points (4) Tabular representation of basal cover for species mapped as polygons (5) Species list including synonymy of names and plant growth forms (6) Inventory of the years each quadrat was sampled (7) Counts of each species recorded at each site and quadrat(8) Tree density and basal area records for overstory plots that surround each quadrat (9) Quadrat centerpoint coordinates in UTM Zone 12 and Latitude/Longitude coordinates, both in North American Datum of 1983 (10) TIFF and PDF maps of all sites and years (n = 1,523 maps)
Margaret M. Moore[1] (margaret.moore@nau.edu) * Jeffrey S. Jenness[2] (jeffj@jennessent.com) * Daniel C. Laughlin[3] (daniel.laughlin@uwyo.edu) Robert T. Strahan[4] (strahanr@sou.edu) Jonathan D. Bakker[5] (jdbakker@uw.edu) Helen E. Dowling[6] (ldowling@pheasantsforever.org) Judith D. Springer[7] (judy.springer@nau.edu)
[1] School of Forestry, Northern Arizona University, Flagstaff, AZ 86011 USA [2] Jenness Enterprises, GIS Analysis and Application Design, Flagstaff, AZ 86004 USA [3] Department of Botany, University of Wyoming, Laramie, WY 82072 USA [4] Southern Oregon University, Ashland, OR 97520 USA [5] School of Environmental and Forest Sciences, University of Washington, Seattle, WA 98195 USA [6] Pheasants Forever, Waterville, WA 98858 USA [7] Ecological Restoration Institute, Northern Arizona University, Flagstaff, AZ 86011 USA *Corresponding authors: Margaret M. Moore [E-mail: Margaret.Moore@nau.edu] and Jeffrey S. Jenness [E-mail: jeffj@jennessent.com]
dataIdInfo.idPurp: This shapefile contains all records of 'Muhlenbergia tricholepis' observed in Quadrat '30731', Site 'Fry Park', in 2011. These single-species shapefiles are formatted to input directly into Integral Projection Modeling (IPM) analysis in R. This shapefile also contains a single polygon representing all other species observed on this quadrat, dissolved into a single object. This 'Other' polygon can be used to investigate crowding and neighbor effects on 'Muhlenbergia tricholepis' in this quadrat.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Northern Arizona University School of Forestry

Consts.useLimit: This dataset is intended for research, planning, and conservation purposes. Contact Dr. Margaret Moore, Northern Arizona University School of Forestry for information regarding the use of these data.

idPoC.rpOrgName: Northern Arizona University School of Forestry
Northern Arizona University School of Forestry

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Original ID Value of this observation, extracted from source shapefiles
Area of polygon of observed plant species, in square meters
Whether observed plant was a seedling: Yes or No. Cannot reliably track herbaceous seedlings, so this field is only used to track ponderosa pine seedlings
X-Coordinate of representative point within polygon of observed plant species

rdom.attrunit: Meter, in custom local coordinate system

attr.attrdef: Y-Coordinate of representative point within polygon of observed plant species

rdom.attrunit: Meter, in custom local coordinate system

attr.attrdef: Quadrat name. These values are based on Quadrat numbers.
Verbatim Species Value. This is the original species recorded on the datasheet. It might be changed in post-processing if it is misspelled or misidentified in the field.
Verbatim Type Value. This is the original type recorded on the datasheet (cover vs. density). This might be changed in post-processing if it is misidentified in the field.
Rotation value. In a few cases, the quadrat was mapped with the wrong orientation on the datasheet. This value indicates the rotation applied to the datasheet to correct it.
Source Shapefile or feature class name
Whether observation is of type Density or Cover
Original Feature ID Value of this observation, extracted from source shapefiles
Whether this is an empty geometry, indicating it was probably a placeholder for a year with no observed species on the quadrat

descript.abstract:
This dataset consists of 98 permanent 1-m2 quadrats located on ponderosa pineâ€“bunchgrass ecosystems in or near Flagstaff, Arizona, USA. Individual plants in these quadrats were identified and mapped annually from 2002-2020. The temporal and spatial data provide unique opportunities to examine the effects of climate and land-use variables on plant demography, population and community processes. The original chart quadrats were established between 1912 and 1927 to determine the effects of livestock grazing on herbaceous plants and pine seedlings. We provide the following data and data formats: (1) Digitized maps in shapefile and file geodatabase format (2) Shapefiles of each individual species observed on each quadrat in each year, organized into separate subfolders by Species, Site and Quadrat. These single-species shapefiles are formatted to input directly into Integral Projection Modeling (IPM) analysis in R. (3) Tabular representation of centroid or point location (x, y coordinates) for species mapped as points (4) Tabular representation of basal cover for species mapped as polygons (5) Species list including synonymy of names and plant growth forms (6) Inventory of the years each quadrat was sampled (7) Counts of each species recorded at each site and quadrat(8) Tree density and basal area records for overstory plots that surround each quadrat (9) Quadrat centerpoint coordinates in UTM Zone 12 and Latitude/Longitude coordinates, both in North American Datum of 1983 (10) TIFF and PDF maps of all sites and years (n = 1,523 maps)

prcStep.stepDesc: Organized feature classes, corrected misspelled or revised species names and converted misclassified species from Cover to Density or vice versa. Placed data in real-world coordinates.
